page.title: 10Steeple and Middle Aston
page.content: The area is in the parliamentary constituency of Banbury and under the Oxfordshire County Council. The local authority is the Cherwell District Council and the area falls within the responsibility of the Steeple Aston and the Middle Aston Parish Councils. St. Peter's Church in Steeple Aston was built in the 13th century and remodelled in the 14th and 15th centuries. It has interesting architectural features and is actively supported by the modern congregations. The Steeple Aston Cope, the greatest treasure of the Church, is now on permanent loan to the V. & A. Museum. It is the remains of a 14th century cope, a good example of English work, and remarkably well preserved.
